alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 10:54AM CST until March 01 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Root River At Franklin affecting Milwaukee County. .The river will fall below flood stage later today. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Root River at Franklin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, A low spot on Oakwood Road in southern Milwaukee County is flooded. Other flooding effects are confined mainly to agricultural land. There is a 50 percent chance in any given year of the river reaching this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Tuesday was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 04/03/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 12 pm... Location stage stage stage/time Wed Thu Fri Sat Franklin 8.0 7.0 8.23 10 am 2/28 7.5 7.3 6.7 6.1 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Franklin 8.44 2 am 2/28 1.91 8.20 12 pm 2/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM CST.
